Cherie, please address the problem using the stack in comment #1
What is the proposed fix and risk/value analysis?

Created an attachment (id=12063)
Patch for PDE UI

NPE was brought on when attempting to patch a non-existent feature.  

Solution:
The appended patch adds an alert when the feature is not found and will not
allow the user to finish (consistent with non-existent parent plug-in in new
fragment wizard).

Dejan & Wassim, please verify when you have a chance.

Thanks!

My concern is that we are requiring the referenced feature to be present 
before we can create a patch. Users may consider this too limiting. We can 
warn the user that the referenced feature cannot be found, but should we 
prevent the project creation altogether?

I would be fine with either approach.
The stricter validation in the fragment wizard is necessary because the 
fragment will not even run if its parent plug-in is not in the target platform 
or workspace.

however, in this case, they can still proceed, but with very little help from 
PDE (e.g. we can't populate the list of plug-ins, etc) since their feature 
does not exist.

Created an attachment (id=12067)
Patch for PDE UI (solution 2)

There can be a case when patches are made for features not yet in the workspace
or target platform.  My original solution for this particular but was to simply
alert the user that the feature could not be found but allow the user to
finish; in this case, the feature version and id would be taken as-is from the
text fields. (see appended patch).

Thanks!

Created an attachment (id=12308)
Patch for PDE UI

This patch allows the user to finish even if the feature specified is not in
the workspace or target platform.  (See Comment #8)

Wassim, please verify the patch when you have a chance.

Looks and works great.
Marking as fixed.
